content.text:
# Draft:2014 Skyward Express Fokker 50 crash

| summary         = Crashed shortly after take off due to mechanical problem
| site            =  near Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, Kenya
| coordinates     =
| aircraft_type   = Fokker 50
| operator        = Skyward Express
| tail_number     = 5Y-CET
| origin          = Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, Nairobi, Kenya
| destination     = Aden Adde International Airport, Mogadishu, Somalia
| occupants       = 4
| passengers      = 2
| crew            = 4
| fatalities      = 4
| survivors       = 0
}}
On July 2 2014, a Fokker 50 operated by Skyward Express on an international cargo flight crashed shortly after take off from Nairobi International Airport, Kenya, the flight was bound for Mogadishu International Airport, Somalia. All four crew members on board were killed. The aircraft crashed into a one story concrete building, the building was closed at the moment of the accident and no one on the ground was killed.
Aircraft and crew
The aircraft involved was a Fokker 50 registered as 5Y-CET, it was built in 1992 and firstly delivered to Lufthansa CityLine. The aircraft was acquired by Skyward Express just two months prior to the crash. The captain was a 54 years old male with 14531 flight hours, of which 6821 were on the Fokker 50. The male first officer had 823 total flight hours, including 513 on the Fokker 50. There were also two non-revenue passengers.
Accident
The aircraft departed from runway 6 of Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, but only about 16 seconds after the initial acceleration alarms started to sound in the cockpit and the aircraft didn't lift more that 50 feet off the ground. The aircraft then deviated in a left direction from the runway. Around 2.1 km northeast of the runway end the aircraft impacted a one story building, that at the time was closed, catching fire.
